data.title: Words Per Minute and Accuracy
data.solution:
import sys
import math

def errors(given_sentence,typed_sentence):
    return sum(given_sentence[i]!=typed_sentence[i] for i in range(len(given_sentence)))

given_sentence = input()
typed_sentence = input()
time = int(input())

wpm = ((len(typed_sentence)/5)/time)*60
accuracy = ((len(typed_sentence) - errors(given_sentence,typed_sentence))/len(given_sentence))*100

print(round(wpm),"WPM")
print(round(accuracy,1),"%")
data.statement:
You are given two strings, [[given_sentence]] and [[typed_sentence]], with the <<same>> amount of characters and an integer [[time]], in seconds. 
The goal is to calculate the [[WPM]] (Words Per Minute), rounded to the nearest whole number, and the [[accuracy]], rounded to 1 decimal place, of the [[typed_sentence]].

Accuracy is based on comparison of characters in the strings at the <<same>> positions.
(If the [[given_sentence]] is "CodinGame!" but the [[typed_sentence]] is "ccCodinGam", the accuracy is 0% and not 80%.)

<<When calculating the WPM, a "word" is equivalent to five keystrokes (including spaces, numbers, letters, and punctuation marks).>>

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given two strings, given_sentence and typed_sentence, with the same amount of characters and an integer time, in seconds.
The goal is to calculate the WPM (Words Per Minute), rounded to the nearest whole number, and the accuracy, rounded to 1 decimal place, of the typed_sentence.

Accuracy is based on comparison of characters in the strings at the same positions.
(If the given_sentence is "CodinGame!" but the typed_sentence is "ccCodinGam", the accuracy is 0% and not 80%.)

When calculating the WPM, a "word" is equivalent to five keystrokes (including spaces, numbers, letters, and punctuation marks).
Input
Line 1: A string given_sentence for the sentence to type.
Line 2: A string typed_sentence for the typed sentence.
Line 3: An integer time,in seconds, for the time it took to type the typed_sentence
Output
Line 1 : An integer WPM, rounded to the nearest whole number, with the letters " WPM" after it.
Line 2 : A float accuracy, rounded to 1 decimal place, with a " %" after it.
Constraints
0< time <=900
5<= given_sentence,typed_sentence length <=300
Example
Input
This is an example to calculate the WPM and the accuracy
This is an exmaple to calculate the wpm and the aacuracy
15
Output
45 WPM
89.3 %
